Uses of Interface
io.github.daveho.funwithsound.Figure

    • Uses of Figure in io.github.daveho.funwithsound

      Classes in io.github.daveho.funwithsound that implement Figure 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CompositeFigure
      A CompositeFigure is a group of one or more Figures, each of which could contain any number of SimpleFigures.
      class  SimpleFigure
      A "simple" figure is a combination of Rhythm, Melody, and Instrument.
      Methods in io.github.daveho.funwithsound that return Figure 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Figure Composer.f(Rhythm rhythm, Melody melody, Instrument instrument)
      Create a figure from a Rhythm, Melody, and Instrument.
      Figure Composer.gf(Figure... figures)
      Combine multiple figures into a single figure.
      Figure Composer.pf(Rhythm rhythm, int note, Instrument instrument)
      Create a "percussion figure", in which a rhythm specifies how to play a single percussion "note", which really designates a particular MIDI percussion instrument (using the MIDI percussion key map.) This method avoids the necessity of creating a Melody.
      Figure Composer.xf(int octave, Figure orig)
      Shift the octave in the melody of a Figure.
      Methods in io.github.daveho.funwithsound with parameters of type Figure 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Composer Composer.add(Figure figure)
      Add a figure to play in the current measure in the current Composition.
      void CompositeFigure.add(Figure child)
      Add a child Figure.
      Composer Composer.add1(Figure figure)
      Add a figure to the composition at the current measure, and advance by exactly one measure.
      Composer Composer.add1n(int n, Figure figure)
      Repeatedly call Composer.add1n(int, Figure) a specified number of times.
      Composer Composer.addn(int n, Figure figure)
      Repeatedly call Composer.add(Figure) a specified number of times.
      Composer Composer.addseq(Figure... figures)
      Call the Composer.add(Figure) method on a series of figures.
      Composer Composer.addseqn(int n, Figure... figures)
      Repeatedly call Composer.addseq(Figure...) a specified number of times.
      Composer Composer.at(int measure, Figure figure)
      Add a figure to play at a specified measure, without changing the current measure.
      Figure Composer.gf(Figure... figures)
      Combine multiple figures into a single figure.
      Figure Composer.xf(int octave, Figure orig)
      Shift the octave in the melody of a Figure.
